Package com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions

Class RealSchurDecomposition

java.lang.Object
com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions.schur.SchurDecompositionOld<Matrix,​Vector>
com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions.schur.RealSchurDecompositionOld
All Implemented Interfaces:
Decomposition<Matrix>
public class RealSchurDecomposition extends SchurDecomposition<Matrix,​Vector>

This class computes the Schur decomposition of a square matrix. That is, decompose a square matrix A into A=UTU<sup>H</sup> where U is a unitary matrix and T is an upper triangular matrix (or possibly block upper triangular matrix) in Schur form whose diagonal entries are the eigenvalues of A.

Note, even if a matrix has only real entries, both Q and U may contain complex values.

  • Field Details

    • realSchur

      private final boolean realSchur
      Flag which indicates if T should be stored in real or complex Schur form. If true, T will be stored in real schur form (default). If false, T\ will be stored in complex schur form.

    • RealSchurDecomposition

      public RealSchurDecomposition​(boolean computeU)
      Creates a decomposer to compute the Schur decomposition.
      Parameters:
      computeU - A flag which indicates if the unitary matrix Q should be computed.
      - If true, the Q matrix will be computed. - If false, the Q matrix will not be computed. If it is not needed, this may provide a performance improvement.

    • RealSchurDecomposition

      public RealSchurDecomposition​(boolean computeU, boolean realSchur)
      Creates a decomposer to compute the Schur decomposition.
      Parameters:
      computeU - A flag which indicates if the unitary matrix Q should be computed.
      - If true, the Q matrix will be computed. - If false, the Q matrix will not be computed. If it is not needed, this may provide a performance improvement.
      realSchur - Flag which indicates weather the real schur form or complex schur form should be computed.

    • decompose

      public RealSchurDecomposition decompose​(Matrix src)

      Computes the Schur decomposition for a real dense square matrix. That is, decompose a square matrix A into A=QUQ<sup>H</sup> where Q is a unitary matrix whose columns are the eigenvectors of A and U is an upper triangular matrix in Schur form whose diagonal entries are the eigenvalues of A, corresponding to the columns of Q, repeated per their multiplicity.

      Note, even if a matrix has only real entries, both Q and U may contain complex values.

      Parameters:
      src - The source matrix to compute the Schur decomposition of.
      Returns:
      A reference to this decomposer.

    • notConverged

      protected boolean notConverged​(int m)
      Checks if an entry along the first sub-diagonal of the T matrix in the Schur decomposition has converged to zero within machine precision. A value is considered to be converged if it is small relative to the two values on the diagonal of the T matrix immediately next to the value of interest. That is, a value at index (m, m-1) is considered converged if it is less in absolute value than the absolute sum of the entries at (m-1, m-1) and (m, m) times machine epsilon (i.e. Math.ulp(1.0d)).
      Specified by:
      notConverged in class SchurDecomposition<Matrix,​Vector>
      Parameters:
      m - Row index of the value of interest within the T matrix.
      Returns:
      True if the specified entry has not converged. That is, the entry in the T matrix is greater than (in absolute value) machine precision (i.e. Math.ulp(1.0)) times the absolute sum of the entries along the block 2x2 matrix on the diagonal of T containing the entry. Otherwise, returns false.
